Linkup is a web search engine for AI app: Linkup is a web search engine for AI apps. Connect your AI application to the internet and get grounding data to enrich your AI's output.
\nTo get your API Key:\n\n1. Go to your:
To get your API Key:

1. Go to your Linkup account dashboard
2. Navigate to API settings
3. Copy your API key
4. Paste it here
Search the web for relevant content base: Search the web for relevant content based on a natural language query. Perfect for grounding LLM responses with factual data.
Fetch a webpage and convert it to markdo: Fetch a webpage and convert it to markdown format. Optionally render JavaScript, include raw HTML, or extract images.
The natural language question or query t: The natural language question or query to search for
Standard returns results faster; deep ta: Standard returns results faster; deep takes longer but yields more comprehensive results
Format of the response. Use structured f: Format of the response. Use structured for custom JSON format.
JSON schema (as a string) for the desire: JSON schema (as a string) for the desired response format. Required only when Output Type is "structured".
Include sources in the response. Only re: Include sources in the response. Only relevant when Output Type is "structured".
Start date for search results in ISO 860: Start date for search results in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD), e.g., 2025-01-01
End date for search results in ISO 8601: End date for search results in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD), e.g., 2025-01-01
Domains to search within (up to 100 doma: Domains to search within (up to 100 domains). Leave empty to search all domains.
Domains to exclude from search results: Domains to exclude from search results
Include inline citations in the answer. Only relevant when Output Type is "sourcedAnswer".
Maximum number of results to return: Maximum number of results to return
The URL of the webpage to fetch: The URL of the webpage to fetch
Render JavaScript on the webpage before: Render JavaScript on the webpage before fetching
Include the raw HTML in the response: Include the raw HTML in the response
